sen.e: Kinsue served as Nai-daijin (Minister of the Center) during the reigns of both Emperors Ichijo and Sanjo, and attempted Kokyu-fuseki (sending female family members to live in the Kokyu Palace) by making his daughter FUJIWARA no Gishi into Kokiden no nyogo (Empress Kokiden) of Emperor Ichijo, but this plan failed as no princesses were born.

sen.j: 晩年の彼が特別に目をかけた嫡孫藤原公成は、生前の官位こそ中納言どまりであったが、死後、娘藤原茂子（藤原能信養女）が生んだ皇子が白河天皇となったことで一族の運を開き、祖父が成し遂げなかった事業を意外にも完成した。
sen.e: Kinsue'e legitimate grandchild FUJIWARA no Kinnari, who was in particular favored by Kinsue in his last years, was promoted only up to Chu-nagon (Middle Counselor) while Kinsue was alive, but after his death, Kinnari's daughter FUJIWARA no Moshi (adopted daughter of FUJIWARA no Yoshinobu) gave birth to a prince who later became Emperor Shirakawa, and this event brought luck to the clan, resulting in unexpected completion of the plan that Kinnari's grandfather, Kinsue, could not complete.

sen.j: 以後、院政期には閑院家の女子が後宮を制覇することになり、公成の孫（公季の5代孫）にあたる大納言藤原公実の三子によって分立した三条家、西園寺家、徳大寺家を筆頭に、この系統の公家は堂上家で25家を数える。
sen.e: From this point on, during the period of the cloistered government, females of the Kanin family dominated the Kokyu, and in the end, there were 25 Dojo families (Court noble family which has a hereditary right to be admitted to the Court) in this family line including the Sanjo, Saionji, and Tokudaiji families that were separated by three children of Dai-nagon FUJIWARA no Kinzane who was the grandchild of Kinnari (the 5th generation down from Kinsue).
